title.narrative: Fishing for Climate Resilience: Empowering vulnerable, fisheries dependent communities adopt ecosystem-based-adaptation measures to secure food and livelihoods

description.narrative: The project will empower vulnerable fisheries dependent communities across Indonesia, the Philippines and Micronesia to identify and adopt ecosystem-based-adaptation (EbA) measures to restore and sustain small-scale fisheries, conserve critical ecosystems and sustain the ecosystem services needed to enhance adaptive capacity, coastal protection, food security and livelihoods. Proven behaviour adoption measures and trainings will strengthen human, technical and institutional capacity needed to build a robust capacity on local and national level to reduce risks to the small scale fisheries sector and to build resilience and food as well as to secure livelihoods. The project will incorporate EbA and disaster risk into coastal fisheries management and thus mainstream EbA into community practice and relevant national strategies (NDCs, NAPs). Trainings will facilitate access to existing climate financing mechanisms. Lessons learnt will be shared regionally and through international forums. The project is part of the IKI Corona Response Package.
